translation: An illusion was created; the sword was shown again and the blow was struck tremblingly.738.
The swords were drawn, the warriors challenged and the blows wre struck with spears.740.
The warriors were raised, caused to fall and run and shown the way . 741.
The warriors were discharged, endured and the warriors were made fearful.742.

gurmukhi: jb sr lwgy ] qb sB Bwgy ] dlpq mwry ] Bt Btkwry ]743]
transliteration: Jab Sar Laage|| Tab Sabh Bhaage|| Dalpat Mdare|| Bhat Bhatdare||743||
translation: When the arrows struck, then all ran away; the generals were killed and the warriors ran hither and thither.743.

gurmukhi: hX qj Bwgy ] rGubr Awgy ] bhu ibD rovYN ] smuih n jovYN ]744]
transliteration: Haya Taj Bhaage|| Raghoubar Aage|| Bahu Bidh Rovain|| Samuh(i) Na Jovain||744||
translation: Leaving their horses, they ran towards Ram and lamenting in various ways, they had no courage to come face to face.744.

gurmukhi: lv Ar mwry ] qv dl hwry ] dYU iss jIqy ] nh BX BIqy ]745]
transliteration: Lav Ar Mdare|| Tav Dal Hdare|| Dvai Sis Jeete|| Nah Bhay Bheete||745||
translation: (The soldiers said to Ram :) “Lava, killing the enemies, has defeated your army; those two boys are fearlessly waging the war and have gained victory,”745.

gurmukhi: lCmn Byjw ] bhu dl lyjw ] ijn iss mwrU ] moih idKwrU ]746]
transliteration: Lachhman Bhejaa|| Bahu Dal Lejaa|| Jin Sis Maroo|| Moh(i) Dikhdaroo||746||
translation: Ram asked Lakshman to take a huge army and sent him; he said to him, “Do not kill those boys, but catch hold of them and show them to me.”746.

gurmukhi: sux lhu BRwqM ] rGubr bwqM ] sj dl c`lXo ] jl Ql h`lXo ]747]
transliteration: Soun Lauh Bhraatan|| Raghoubar Baatan|| Saj Dal Challyo|| Jal Thal Hallyo||747||
translation: Hearing the words of Raghuvir, Lakshman started, decorating his forces and sharing the waters and the planes.747.

gurmukhi: auT dl DUrM ] nB JV pUrM ] chU ids FUky ] hir hir kUky ]748]
transliteration: Outh Dal Dhooran|| Nabh Jhad Pooran|| Chahu Dis Dhooke|| Har(i) Har(i) Kooke||748||
translation: The sky was filled with dust because of the movement of army, all the soldiers rushed forth from all the four directions and began to remember the name of the Lord.748.

gurmukhi: brKq bwxM ] iQrkq juAwxM ] lh lh DujxM ] KhKh BujxM ]749]
transliteration: Barkhat Baanan|| Thirkat Juaanan|| Lah Lah Dhujanan|| Khah-khah Bhujanan||749||
translation: The staggering soldiers began to shower arrows, the banners waved and the arms fought with one another.749.

gurmukhi: his his FUky ] kis kis kUky ] sux sux bwlM ] hiT qj auqwlM ]750]
transliteration: Has(i) Has(i) Dhooke|| Kas(i) Kas(i) Kooke|| Soun Soun Baalan|| Hath(i) Taj Outaalan||750||
translation: Coming near smilingly they shouted loudly, “O boys ! forsake your persistence quickly.”750.
